questions.question: Which equation gave a smaller value for molar volume at high pressure?
Why does the Van der Waals equation predict a lower molar volume than the Ideal Gas equation at high pressures?

answers.c: It accounts for molecular volume and attractive forces

questions.question: Based on the experiment, when do the Ideal Gas and Van der Waals equations give nearly the same molar volume?

answers.a: At high pressure and low temperature
answers.b: At low pressure and high temperature
answers.d: At low pressure and low temperature

questions.question: If your calculated molar volume using the Van der Waals equation is significantly different from expected values, which factor is most likely responsible?

answers.c: Incorrect 'a' and 'b' constants for the gas used

questions.question: What can you conclude from the experiment about real gases compared to ideal gases?

answers.a: Real gases always behave like ideal gases
answers.b: Ideal gas law works well under all conditions
answers.c: Real gases deviate from ideal behavior under non-ideal conditions
answers.d: Van der Waals equation is not useful for real gases
